laid.label: API Key (LAID)
laid.tooltip: The linksync Application ID (LAID) is a unique API Key that's created when you link two apps via the linksync dashboard. You need a valid API Key for this linksync module to work.
laid.comment: Note that once you save your API Key it will be permanently linked to this site. If you change the URL of the site, or want to use the API Key on a different site, you’ll need to contact linksync support to have them reset the Site URL.

merchant_location_id.label: eParcel Merchant Location ID
merchant_location_id.tooltip: Issued by Australia Post. A unique three or five alphanumeric character identifier for your geographic merchant location where eParcels are prepared and/or lodged.
merchant_location_id.comment: Changing the Merchant Location ID will result in any consignments not dispatched to become invalid

post_charge_to_account.label: eParcel Post Charge to Account
post_charge_to_account.tooltip: Issued by Australia Post. Merchant account to which Australia Post “post” the charges against for invoicing purposes.

merchant_id.label: Merchant Id
merchant_id.tooltip: Issued by Australia Post. Merchant ID with Australia Post, for inclusion on the Manifest Summary Report. You can find this ID on Manifest Summary reports produced using the eParcel Portal.

lodgement_facility.label: Lodgement facility
lodgement_facility.tooltip: Issued by Australia Post. The Lodgement Facility associated with your Merchant Location ID, for inclusion on the Manifest Summary Report.

sftp_username.label: SFTP username
sftp_username.tooltip: Issued by Australia Post. Your username for uploading manifests to Australia Post SFTP service.

sftp_password.label: SFTP password
sftp_password.tooltip: Issued by Australia Post. The password associated with your username for uploading manifests to Australia Post SFTP service.

lps_username.label: LPS username
lps_username.tooltip: The LPS username relate to the Australia Post Label Printing Service - please contact linksync for further information.
lps_username.comment: The format of the LPS username should look similar to '6f4d9019-cxx4-4e5c-x786-0753b97d903e@auspost.com.au' - please refer to Registering for Australia Post Label Print Service (LPS) for more information.

lps_password.label: LPS password
lps_password.tooltip: The LPS password relate to the Australia Post Label Printing Service - please contact linksync for further information.

operation_mode.label: Operation Mode
operation_mode.tooltip: Test mode enables you to use and test all features of the linksync eParcel for Magento module without actually submitting a manifest to Australia Post on despatch of a manifest. Live mode will upload your manifest to Australia Post SFTP server on despatch of a manifest.

return_address_name.label: Return Contact Name
return_address_name.tooltip: The company name you want to appear on the 'Sender' section of the eParcel labels and 'Customer Address' on Manifest Summary Reports, as well as the 'Delivery Address' on Return Labels.

return_business_name.label: Return Business Name
return_business_name.tooltip: The business name you want to appear in the return address information on labels.

return_email_address.label: Return Email Address
return_email_address.tooltip: The email address you want to appear in the return address information on labels.

return_phone_number.label: Return Phone Number
return_phone_number.tooltip: The phone number you want to appear in the return address information on labels

return_address_line1.label: Return Address Line 1
return_address_line1.tooltip: The address you want to appear on the 'Sender' section of the eParcel labels and 'Customer Address' on Manifest Summary Reports, as well as the 'Delivery Address' on Return Labels.

return_address_suburb.label: Return Address Suburb
return_address_suburb.tooltip: The suburb you want to appear on the 'Sender' section of the eParcel labels and 'Customer Address' on Manifest Summary Reports, as well as the 'Delivery Address' on Return Labels.

return_address_postcode.label: Return Address Postcode
return_address_postcode.tooltip: The postcode you want to appear on the 'Sender' section of the eParcel labels and 'Customer Address' on Manifest Summary Reports, as well as the 'Delivery Address' on Return Labels.

return_address_statecode.label: Return Address State code
return_address_statecode.tooltip: The State you want to appear on the 'Sender' section of the eParcel labels and 'Customer Address' on Manifest Summary Reports, as well as the 'Delivery Address' on Return Labels.

insurance.label: Insurance
insurance.tooltip: Add insurance to consignment articles by default? This default can be overridden when creating consignments/articles.

default_insurance_value.label: Default Insurance value
default_insurance_value.tooltip: Default insurance value to add to consignment articles. This default can be overridden when creating consignments/articles.

signature_required.label: Signature Required
signature_required.tooltip: Default setting for 'Signature Required' on consignments. This default can be overridden when creating consignments. Note: if set to 'No', customers will be prompted to confirm that they authorise their delivery to be left if no one is available to sign for it, and then be required to enter special instructions. eg 'leave at side door' - these instructions will show on labels associated with the consignment for the order.

safe_drop.label: Safe Drop
safe_drop.tooltip: Your customers can interact “in flight” with their ‘Signature on Delivery” domestic eParcel service and request that Australia Post leave the parcel in a Safe Place (Authority To Leave) without a signature. Select No to disable this option.

partial_delivery_allowed.label: Partial Delivery Allowed
partial_delivery_allowed.tooltip: Default setting for specifying if partial delivery is allowed for consignments. This default can be overridden when creating consignments.

post_email_notification.label: Australia Post email notification
post_email_notification.tooltip: Default setting for using Australia Post's email notification service on consignments. This default can be overridden when creating consignments.

apply_to_all.label: Apply eParcel shipping to all AU orders
apply_to_all.tooltip: Select this option if you want to apply eParcel shipping and management to all of your existing Magento shipping rules and options, including orders via M2E Pro. If you would like to apply different eParcel shipping types to the different shipping methods you offer, we recommend you use our 'Assign Shipping Types' option instead.

default_chargecode.label: Default Charge code for above orders
default_chargecode.tooltip: Enter the eParcel Charge Code you want to associate with all of your existing Magento shipping rules and options.

default_has_tariff.label: Default HS Tariff
default_has_tariff.comment:
The number should be a positive integer between 6-12.
Click here for HS Tariff list

user_order_details.label: User order details for description on customs docs

copy_order_notes.label: Copy order notes to label?
copy_order_notes.tooltip: If set to yes, then order notes would be copied to label

use_order_total_weight.label: Use order total weight
use_order_total_weight.tooltip: If your products in Magento have weights associated with them, you can use this option to use the total weight of the combined items on an order as the weight for the consignment.

packaging_allowance_type.label: Packaging Allowance Type
packaging_allowance_type.tooltip: Use this option if you want to add additional weight to your order total to allow for packaging. Use 'Fixed' if you want to add a set weight to each order, or use Percentage to add an allowance based on a percentage of the total weight for each order.

packaging_allowance_value.label: Packaging Allowance Value
packaging_allowance_value.tooltip: Depending on the option you choose for 'Packaging Allowance Type', this value will determine what value to add to the total weight of the combined items on an order. If you select Fixed, then input the additional weight you want to add in KG. eg. .25 for .25 kg/250 grams. If you select percentage, then input the percentage you want to add to an order eg. 5 for 5%. Leave this field empty if you don't want to apply a packaging allowance to orders.

product_unit.label: Product Weight Unit
product_unit.tooltip: Select if you have input product weight in KG or grams. Aust Post eParcel requires that all weights are in KG, so if your product weight is entered in Magento in grams, the combined order weight will be converted to KG for consignment and articles weights.

default_article_weight.label: Default Article Weight (Kgs)
default_article_weight.tooltip: Set a default Article Weight. This value is used as the default value when selecting 'Custom' article type, and can be overridden when creating articles. Leave blank if you don't want to set a default.

use_article_dimensions.label: Use article dimensions
use_article_dimensions.tooltip: If you're on a dead-weight of cubic-weight contract with Australia Post, then you may not be required to enter dimensions for each article you ship with eParcel. If that's the case, then set this option to No. If you are required to enter dimensions for articles, then set this option to Yes.

default_article_height.label: Default Article Height (cm)
default_article_height.tooltip: Set a default Article Height. This value is used as the default value when selecting 'Custom' article type, and can be overridden when creating articles. Leave blank if you don't want to set a default.

default_article_width.label: Default Article Width (cm)
default_article_width.tooltip: Set a default Article Width. This value is used as the default value when selecting 'Custom' article type, and can be overridden when creating articles. Leave blank if you don't want to set a default.

default_article_length.label: Default Article Length (cm)
default_article_length.tooltip: Set a default Article Length. This value is used as the default value when selecting 'Custom' article type, and can be overridden when creating articles. Leave blank if you don't want to set a default.

display_order_status.label: Display order status on Consignment View
display_order_status.tooltip: Set this option to Yes if you want the Magento order status for all orders to be displayed in the consignment view.

display_choosen_status.label: Choose the statuses to show in the consignment view?
display_choosen_status.tooltip: By default, orders that have a status of 'Pending', 'Processing' or have an open consignment against them are displayed in the Consignment View. If you'd like to choose different order statuses to display in the Consignment View then set this option to Yes.

chosen_statuses.label: Select the statuses
chosen_statuses.tooltip: Select one or more order statuses to display in the Consignment View. Only orders with matching Order Statuses will be displayed in the Consignment View.

change_order_status.label: Change order status on despatch of Manifest
change_order_status.tooltip: Use this option to change the order status when a manifest is despatched.

change_shipping_method.label: Change order shipping option
change_shipping_method.tooltip: Select this option if you want to change the order's current shipping option to other shipping options.

notify_customers.label: Notify Customers on despatch of Manifest
notify_customers.tooltip: Use this option to notify customers of tracking numbers when a manifest is despatched. This default can be overridden when creating consignments.

from_email_address.label: From email address
from_email_address.tooltip: The 'from' email address to be used when notifying customers of tracking information when a manifest is despatched.

subject.label: Subject
subject.comment: You can use the [TrackingNumber],[OrderNumber], [CustomerFirstname] dynamic variables

email_body.label: Email Body
email_body.comment: You can use the [TrackingNumber],[OrderNumber], [CustomerFirstname] dynamic variables

sendlog.label: Send Log
sendlog.comment: To be used if instructed by linksync support

mark_despatch.label: Enable Mark as Despatched Action on Consignment UI
mark_despatch.tooltip: To be used if instructed by linksync support
